result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason C. Hankey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, DNA surcharges, and Domestic Abuse surcharges. Bond applied.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Have a Mental Health Assessment and comply with treatment recommendations from the assesment.

Take all medications as prescribed.
Sign necessary releases so agent can monitor mental health records and prescription medications.
Attend and complete Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program.
Engage with other counseling as recommended by the agent.
Not to have any abusive contact with R.D.
Submit DNA Sample.

timeConds.notes: Huber granted for employment or any counseling Defendant is currently in. No electronic monitoring, straight jail sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason C. Hankey in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:38 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea and sentencing.
There is an agreement.
State has filed an amended information, charges remained the same but removed the domestic abuse enhancer. 

Defendant will plead to all 3 counts.
State files a victim impact statement.

Atty Kryshak concurs.
Atty Kryshak has received a copy of the amended information and waives reading.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 3

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kryshak for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
Victim was given notification, is not present but did provide the impact statement.
Court reads the impact statement at this time.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 2: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 3: Contrary to the statute section stated therein

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court, concurs with Atty Knaapen. Previous probation expired.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 150 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Jail sentence of 2 Days
Huber granted for employment or any counseling Defendant is currently in. No electronic monitoring, straight jail sentence.
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Have a Mental Health Assessment and comply with treatment recommendations from the assesment
Take all medications as prescribed
Sign necessary releases so agent can monitor mental health records and prescription medications
Attend and complete Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program
Engage with other counseling as recommended by the agent
Not to have any abusive contact with R.D.
Submit DNA Sample
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay costs
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge

Count 2:
Jail sentence of 150 Days, Imposed and Stayed, concurrent to Count 1
Jail sentence of 2 Days
Huber granted for employment or any counseling Defendant is currently in. No electronic monitoring, straight jail sentence.
Probation for a period of 24 Months concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge

Count 3:
Jail sentence of 90 Days, Imposed and Stayed, concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
Jail sentence of 2 Days
Huber granted for employment or any counseling Defendant is currently in. No electronic monitoring, straight jail sentence.
Probation for a period of 24 Months concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
Conditions: 
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 and Count 2
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge

If Defendant complies with all terms of probation, Defendant will not have to go to jail.
Any bond posted is to be applied to fine/costs in this action.
20 days in which to appeal the case.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

Court enters NOT GUILTY Plea(s).

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Atty Lucsay regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Defendant Jason C. Hankey in court with attorney Amber Day Lucsay. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Defendant Jason C. Hankey not in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin . Matter rescheduled.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jason C. Hankey in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Amber Lucsay called and indicated she is stranded in Madison due to severe thunderstorms.  Asks the case be continued.  
Atty Drengler indicates he was appointed thru the Public Defender but has since retained private counsel. Asks the court to allow Atty Drengler to withdraw at this time.  
Defendant concurs. 

BY THE COURT:  Matter to continue.  Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel - Atty Drengler
CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan and consents to contact filed by: Rhonda Deschler

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *Rhonda Deschler  *Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no violent or abusive contact with the above named.
**07-30-15:   CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan and consents to contact filed by: Rhonda Deschler***

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Battery/Domestic.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $750 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:    @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch
